title: Bat as food
summary: Bats are eaten by people in parts of some Asian, African, Pacific Rim countries[1] and cultures, including Vietnam, Seychelles, the Philippines,[2][3][4] Indonesia,[5] Palau, Thailand,[6] China,[7] and Guam.[8][9] Half the megabat (fruit bat) species are hunted for food but only eight percent of the insectivorous bat species.[10] In Guam, Mariana fruit bats (Pteropus mariannus) are considered a delicacy.[11][12]
